image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

items.synopsis: After a brief downturn earlier in the year, Australia's housing market is firmly in recovery mode, with CoreLogic data showing house prices increased for a sixth consecutive month in August.

title.children: House prices rise for a sixth straight month, with interest rate outlook likely to see 'active' selling season

image.altText: A close up street view of an old Japanese house next to an apartment building.

items.synopsis: How does Tokyo's property market compare to Australia's? Here are four unique lessons, from loose zoning laws to smaller dwelling sizes, an advanced public transport system and an openness to development.

title.children: The four unique ways Tokyo approaches housing can offer lessons for Australia

image.altText: Ada sits at a table in the senate hearing, behind a microphone, wearing a black blouse, mid-speech.

items.synopsis: A heavily pregnant public servant spent weeks during Canberra's winter "holed up" in a tiny room and only turned on central heating after going into labour, a Senate inquiry has heard.

title.children: 'I work for the public service, for crying out loud': ACT's rental crisis laid bare in Senate hearing

image.altText: A person holds a Voice to Parliament official referendum booklet

items.synopsis: The Voice to Parliament campaign is already rife with misinformation. Here are some eyebrow-raising claims you may have seen about the referendum and how you can help ABC Investigations expose more like them.

title.children: Do these claims about the Voice raise an eyebrow? Here's what they're actually about

image.altText: Australiam Army soldiers stand at attention during an Anzac Day parade

items.synopsis: Hundreds of soldiers could be moved out of South Australia under a planned restructure of the army, with the Department of Defence considering options on how best to transform the service for future "littoral" operations.

title.children: Army considers removing Adelaide-based units

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

items.synopsis: The chair of the inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann releases his correspondence with the ACT government by way of denying he breached the law when he provided copies of the report to two journalists before it was released by the ACT government.

title.children: Inquiry head denies breaking law by leaking report into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution to media

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: James, Andrew and Peter Buttle apply to have the charges they are facing over the deadly 2019 eruption of their volcano dismissed.

title.children: Brothers who inherited NZ volcano ask judge to drop charges, claiming 'this is not a prosecution of a family'

image.altText: Close up of Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce speaking to the media at a press event.

items.synopsis: Qantas has confirmed it will refund $570 million worth of COVID travel credits for domestic and international customers, while the ACCC has accused the airline of selling tickets for flights it had already cancelled.

title.children: 'People lost faith in the process': Qantas scraps expiry dates on $570m worth of COVID travel credits

image.altText: A man wearing a suit brings his hands to prayer position in front of his face

items.synopsis: Thaksin, Thailand's most famous politician, returned to his country last week after spending 15 years in self-imposed exile. Upon his arrival he was taken to prison to serve an eight-year sentence for abuse of power and conflicts of interest.

title.children: Thailand's billionaire ex-prime minister requests royal pardon after 15 years in exile

image.altText: Shrubs growing around a street tree on a nature strip beside a road.

items.synopsis: From growing gardens and laying artificial turf to parking cars and trailers, here's what you can and can't do with the nature strip out the front of your Canberra home.

title.children: What you can and can't do on the nature strip outside your Canberra home

image.altText: A woman with brown hair holding a drink.

items.synopsis: Human remains which were found beside the Hume highway in Goulburn have been identified as a Sydney woman who was murdered by her former boyfriend.

title.children: Human remains found by highway in Goulburn confirmed to be those of murdered Sydney woman

image.altText: A large ladder reaches at the top of the building with a firefighter in front of it

items.synopsis: One of the deadliest South African fires leads to at least 73 deaths and scores of injuries, according to emergency services.

title.children: 'Sad day for the city of Johannesburg': More than 70 dead in building blaze

image.altText: An aerial photo of the snowy mountain hydro-electric complex at dusk.

items.synopsis: The government reveals planned expansions to the Snowy Hydro have suffered an incredible $10 billion blowout over price estimates given by former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull six years ago.

title.children: Snowy Hydro expansion hits reset button as costs blow out to $12 billion

image.altText: Don and Gail, dressed in warm jackets, smile as they stand in front of the sea on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: The town of Korumburra in Victoria's south-east has come together to celebrate the life of Don and Gail Patterson, who police believe died from mushroom poisoning at a family lunch in July.

title.children: 'Lots of love to you all': Suspected mushroom poisoning victim's text to family revealed at memorial service

image.altText: Chris Bowen in a navy suit and tie in front of the Australian flag at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Chris Bowen's comments follow warnings from the Australian Energy Market Operator that a hot and dry summer will put Victoria and South Australia at "elevated" risk of blackouts.

title.children: Energy minister says federal government wants power grid 'as stable as it possibly can be'

image.altText: Aerial photo showing a series of arrays of mirrors arranged in semi-circles facing individual towers

items.synopsis: Renewable energy company RayGen has officially opened its $27 million solar and thermal power plant project, in north-west Victoria.

title.children: These solar energy modules generate enough heat to melt metal. It's hoped they can help solve renewable storage issues

image.altText: A young woman smiling

items.synopsis: Bailey Camilleri streamed The Big Bang Theory for about 10 minutes before his truck crashed into a car, killing Gemma Thompson just two weeks before her wedding.

title.children: Jail for truck driver who streamed sitcom on his phone before crash that killed Sydney teacher

image.altText: A composite image showing rock singer Jimmy Barnes, politician Clive Palmer and rapper Eminem.

items.synopsis: Rapper Eminem this week demanded Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy stop playing Lose Yourself on the campaign trail. Here are 10 other instances politicians have gotten the cold shoulder from artists they admired.

title.children: 'Moronic charade of a campaign': Ten times musicians told politicians to quit playing their music

image.altText: A food delivery rider on a bicycle with a crowd of people in the distance.

items.synopsis: The workplace minister says a small increase to the cost of pizza deliveries is "a small price to pay" to ensure gig workers are safe, as the government unveils its plan for minimum rates of pay for workers earning income through apps such as Uber and DoorDash.

title.children: New minimum pay rates for gig workers worth 'small increase' to pizza prices, says minister

image.altText: An drilling machine on a lake, blue sky with clouds, a drill in themiddle and two small boats on the side.

items.synopsis: A review of Gold Fields, which runs four mines in Australia,  has found that 47 per cent of its global workforce had experienced some form of inappropriate behaviour at work.

title.children: Global gold giant apologises for 'distressing' findings of widespread sexual harassment and bullying

image.altText: A man with a moustache in front of a party tent.

items.synopsis: The Queensland Supreme Court heard Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden lived at home in what was a "dysfunctional, toxic relationship".

title.children: Gold Coast councillor charged with murdering his stepfather released on bail after urgent hearing

image.altText: A semi-trailer and a wrecked car covered with a tarpaulin on the side of a country road.

items.synopsis: Police say a B-double truck travelling north on the Hume collided with a car that was turning onto the freeway, killing all four people inside. The truck driver, 30, was taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Police investigate after four killed in truck, car collision in north-east Victoria

image.altText: an artist impression building with horses

items.synopsis: The cost of plans to move SA's mounted operations unit has been revealed, with the government confirming details of its new site.

title.children: Relocation of South Australian police horses set to cost $90 million

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with his hands up.

items.synopsis: With South Australia and Tasmania considered the key states in contest in the Voice to Parliament referendum, the prime minister hits Hobart after his visit to SA on Wednesday to announce the date of the referendum.

title.children: 'Convinced Tasmanians will vote Yes': Albanese spruiks Voice in Hobart on first full campaign day

image.altText: Ryan Papenhuyzen runs towards Sualauvi Faalogo who is on the floor, with his hands outstretched

items.synopsis: Brisbane miss out on the chance to seal the NRL minor premiership as Melbourne records a 14th-straight win over the Broncos at Lang Park as the second-string step up for the Storm.

title.children: 'Bitterly disappointing': Broncos miss chance to seal NRL minor premiership as Storm hoodoo remains

image.altText: Gloved hands hold a selection of vapes above a bin of multi-coloured objects.

items.synopsis: A state school on Queensland's Gold Coast turns away from its hardline stance on vaping, in favour of an educational approach that's now being shared with other schools.

title.children: This school abandoned automatic suspensions for vaping. Here's what happened

image.altText: Woman in purple being handcuffed

items.synopsis: These "custodial killers" are often healthcare workers who murder helpless or dependent people in their care, writes Xanthe Mallett.

title.children: Why serial killers like Lucy Letby often work in healthcare

image.altText: Aerial view of cleared land surrounded by trees. Dozens of long white tubular greenhouses are in three rows on cleared land.

items.synopsis: In sentencing, Judge Tony Moynihan KC took into account that the men were paid a wage of $3,000 a month but would not be receiving any profit from the crop.

title.children: Two men jailed for three years over their role in growing $100m cannabis crop

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and carrying a briefcase smiles as he walks past

items.synopsis: Former energy minister Grant Shapps has been announced as his replacement, a promotion for a man relied upon by the government as a good media communicator but lacking in direct experience of the military.

title.children: Ben Wallace resigns as UK defence minister, Grant Shapps confirmed as his replacement

image.altText: A woman wearing a purple hoodie with her hair tied back walking with three other women

items.synopsis: A mother of six who fatally stabbed her partner in the thigh had endured violence in a "seriously dangerous" relationship that was "going to end in tragedy", a court has heard.

title.children: Relationship 'plagued by alcohol abuse, violence' ends in mum stabbing partner to death

image.altText: Family and supporters wearing black t-shirts depicting Jomen as an angel

items.synopsis: Coroner Philip Urquhart finds prison staff knew about Mr Blanket's "suicide plan" eight weeks before he died and should have acted differently.

title.children: 'Chronic shortage' of safe cells enabled Indigenous man to take his own life in WA prison, coroner finds

image.altText: A man wearing a wet purple tshirt stands in knee-deep water filled with tree branches in the street

items.synopsis: Video footage and photographs from the region around Idalia's landfall showed ocean waters washing over highways and neighbourhoods swamped by extensive flooding as residents inspected the damage.

title.children: 'All hell broke loose': Hurricane Idalia tore down houses and flooded neighbourhoods in Florida
